intro: Capnorea fulcrata, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse easily. Capnorea fulcrata is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats.
